Notes.Text:
This update for blktrace fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2018-10689: Prevent buffer overflow in the dev_map_read function because
  the device and devno arrays were too small (bsc#1091942)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution for Non-Commercial usage (CC-BY-NC-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Development Tools 15

Vulnerabilities.Description: blktrace (aka Block IO Tracing) 1.2.0, as used with the Linux kernel and Android, has a buffer overflow in the dev_map_read function in btt/devmap.c because the device and devno arrays are too small, as demonstrated by an invalid free when using the btt program with a crafted file.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Development Tools 15:blktrace-1.1.0+git.20170126-3.3.28
